page.title: 04LIFE ON A FARM
page.content: I asked Catherine what it is like to live on a farm. She said{"It is {quite nice but my Uncle and Grandad {have to work quite hard. We have cows {and sheep".}How many cows and sheep have you got?{"I suppose we have got {approximately 200-300 sheep,90 cows {and 20-25 calves."}What time is lambing and how do you cope?{"Lambing {time is usually between February and {June. What do you mean by how do I {cope?".}I mean how do you know they are going to have them in the middle of the night?{"You dont."}What crops do you grow?{"All sorts, such as {wheat, barley and corn".}Do you have a pet lamb or calf?{"Well, I have got a {pet hogg and some calves, called {Henry, Hen, Choca, Sauce and Darling. {A hogg is a year-old male sheep. His {name is Rambi. I have got one cat, a {sheep-dog and a guard-dog."
